concepts.name: Patient-Centered Care
concepts.description: An approach to healthcare that emphasizes partnerships between practitioners and patients, treating patients as individuals with unique needs and preferences.

concepts.name: Biomedical Sensors
concepts.description: Devices that detect biological, chemical, or physical signals from the body and convert them into measurable electrical outputs.

concepts.name: Digital Health
concepts.description: The use of information and communication technologies in medicine and other health professions to manage illnesses and health risks and to promote wellness.

concepts.name: Continuous Monitoring
concepts.description: The process of regularly observing and recording the activities of a system or changes in a condition over time without interruption.

concepts.name: Non-invasive Diagnostics
concepts.description: Medical tests that do not involve penetrating the skin or entering body cavities, reducing patient discomfort and risks.

concepts.name: Precision Medicine
concepts.description: A medical approach that proposes the customization of healthcare, with medical decisions and treatments tailored to individual patients.

concepts.name: Closed-Loop Systems
concepts.description: Systems that use feedback to control themselves without human intervention, with output from the system influencing future operations.

concepts.name: Biosignal Processing
concepts.description: The analysis and interpretation of signals obtained from biological sources, often for diagnostic or monitoring purposes.

concepts.name: Telemedicine
concepts.description: The remote delivery of healthcare services and information using telecommunications technology.

concepts.name: Medical Device Interoperability
concepts.description: The ability of medical devices to connect and exchange information with other systems or devices to improve patient care.

relationships.description: Biomedical sensors provide the data acquisition capability necessary for continuous monitoring of patient parameters.
Digital health is a broad concept that encompasses telemedicine as one of its applications.
Non-invasive diagnostics improve patient experience and comfort, aligning with patient-centered care principles.
Continuous monitoring systems generate the real-time data needed for closed-loop control systems.
Advanced biosignal processing allows extraction of personalized health insights that enable precision medicine approaches.
Interoperability between medical devices enhances the effectiveness and reach of digital health solutions.
Telemedicine technologies facilitate remote continuous monitoring of patients outside traditional healthcare settings.
Precision medicine approaches exemplify patient-centered care by tailoring treatments to individual characteristics.

best_practices.name: User-Centered Design for Medical Devices
best_practices.description: Designing medical devices with direct input from end-users throughout the development process, considering their needs, preferences, and limitations.
implementation_steps: Conduct user research with patients and healthcare providers
Create user personas and scenarios
Develop prototypes for user testing
Iterate design based on user feedback
Validate final design with usability testing

best_practices.name: Data Privacy by Design
best_practices.description: Incorporating privacy protections from the initial design stages of health technologies rather than adding them retrospectively.
benefits: Ethical handling of sensitive health information
implementation_steps: Conduct privacy impact assessments
Implement data minimization principles
Design robust authentication and access controls
Use encryption for data at rest and in transit
Create transparent privacy policies

best_practices.name: Non-invasive Sampling Techniques
best_practices.description: Using methods that collect biological signals or samples without breaking the skin or entering body cavities.
implementation_steps: Explore optical, electrical, or acoustic sensing modalities
Validate against gold standard invasive methods
Optimize signal processing to improve accuracy
Address motion artifacts and environmental interference
Design for long-term wearability and comfort

best_practices.name: Closed-Loop Validation Methodologies
best_practices.description: Rigorous testing protocols for autonomous medical systems that make therapeutic decisions without human intervention.
benefits: Identification of edge cases and failure modes
implementation_steps: Develop comprehensive simulation environments
Conduct in vitro testing with physiological models
Perform animal studies when appropriate
Design phased clinical trials with safety monitoring
Implement post-market surveillance mechanisms

best_practices.name: Interoperability Standards Adoption
best_practices.description: Implementing established healthcare data and device standards to ensure different systems can exchange and use information.
implementation_steps: Adopt standards like HL7 FHIR, IEEE 11073, or DICOM
Participate in interoperability testing events
Implement standard APIs and interfaces
Document conformance to relevant standards
Engage with standards development organizations
